properties.areaDesc: Olomana; Kauai Windward; Maui Windward West; Windward Haleakala; Oahu Koolau; South Big Island; Big Island North and East; Molokai Windward
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 6 at 3:48PM HST until January 10 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU
MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND...

.Strong trade winds near and upstream of the islands will produce
increasingly large and rough surf along east facing shores. Surf
is expected to steadily rise through the week and peak around
warning levels later in the week.

* WHAT...Surf heights of 6 to 9 feet tonight, rising to 7 to 12
feet Tuesday and continuing to build through Friday.

* WHERE...East facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Maui, and
Big Island.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break,
and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming
difficult and dangerous.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of high surf and unusually
high water levels could cause additional coastal erosion,
especially during the early morning high tides.
properties.instruction:
Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by
ocean safety officials and exercise caution.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST FRIDAY
